subs.text: @AD_Lobel Two entered Orthodox and came out gay. Two entered from Conservative families and came out as transdenominational Jewish communal professionals. Two got semicha. The other two were engaged to the same woman (and one married her).
subs.rawText: @AD_Lobel Two entered Orthodox and came out gay. Two entered from Conservative families and came out as transdenominational Jewish communal professionals. Two got semicha. The other two were engaged to the same woman (and one married her).

subs.text: @MisfitTorah Tanakh strongly platforms the critics of the establishment. Its only constructive utopian suggestions relate to architecture.
subs.rawText: @MisfitTorah Tanakh strongly platforms the critics of the establishment. Its only constructive utopian suggestions relate to architecture.

subs.text: @MisfitTorah Implicitly, it opposes systems of government that throw critics out windows.
subs.rawText: @MisfitTorah Implicitly, it opposes systems of government that throw critics out windows.

subs.text: @MisfitTorah While the closest I came to reading Milton was hearing R Aharon z‚Äùl give a shiur once, I suspect the first strong defense of press freedom makes explicit reference to Tanakh. So there‚Äôs that.
